titlestmt.titleproper: National Organization of Women, Connecticut Chapter Records 1996.0014
National Organization of Women, Connecticut Chapter Records
titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Ashley Norris.

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-01-02T11:54-0500

did.unittitle: National Organization for Women, Connecticut Chapter Records

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The collection contains the administrative records of the Connecticut Chapter of the National Organization for Women. CT NOW believes that the personal is indeed political; therefore it strives to impact and change attitudes, beliefs, and policies that harm all women by fighting for political, economic, and social justice through education, organizing and action.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The National Organization for Women is the largest organization of feminist activists in the United States. NOW has more than 500,000 contributing members and more than 500 local and campus affiliates in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. Since our founding in 1966, NOW's goal has been "to take action" to bring about equality for all women. Both the actions NOW takes and its position on the issues are principled, uncompromising and often ahead of their time.
Detailed information about the history and activities of the organization is available on the NOW website.

CT NOW believes that the personal is indeed political; therefore it strives to impact and change attitudes, beliefs, and policies that harm all women by fighting for political, economic, and social justice through education, organizing and action. This purpose includes, but is not limited to, equal rights and responsibilities in all aspects of citizenship, public service, employment, education, family life, and it includes freedom from discrimination because of race, gender or perceived gender, ethnicity, origin, age, marital status, sexual preference/orientation, physical ability/health status, or parenthood.
Information about the Connecticut Chapter is available on their website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the documentation of the programs, activities and administration of the Connecticut Chapter of the National Organization for Women.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Natioanl Organization for Women, Connecticut Chapter Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection has been transferred by the Chapter in installments beginning in 1996.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut based organizations and politics. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.
